@graph.name: How to Optimize Shopify URL Structure
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide to understanding and optimizing Shopify URL structures for better SEO performance.

step.name: Understand Default URL Structure
step.text: Learn about Shopify's default URL format: yourstorename.myshopify.com and fixed subdirectories like /products/, /collections/, /blogs/.

step.name: Set Up Custom Domain
step.text: Navigate to Online Store > Domains in Shopify admin, purchase or connect a custom domain, and set it as primary domain.

step.name: Optimize URL Slugs
step.text: Create SEO-friendly slugs for products, collections, and blog posts using relevant keywords and clear naming conventions.

step.name: Configure 301 Redirects
step.text: Set up URL redirects in Online Store > Navigation > URL Redirects to handle old URLs and prevent 404 errors.

mainEntity.name: How do I change my Shopify store URL?

acceptedAnswer.text: To change your Shopify store URL, you need to purchase and connect a custom domain through the Shopify admin. Navigate to Online Store > Domains, and either buy a new domain or connect an existing one. Once connected, set the new domain as your primary domain under the domains section.

mainEntity.name: Can I remove '/products/' or '/collections/' from my Shopify URLs?

acceptedAnswer.text: Shopify does not allow the removal of /products/ or /collections/ from the default URL structure. These subdirectories are built into the Shopify system to help organize content. However, you can optimize the URL slugs for clarity and SEO performance.

mainEntity.name: What is a 301 redirect, and how do I set it up on Shopify?

acceptedAnswer.text: A 301 redirect permanently forwards traffic from one URL to another, preserving SEO value and preventing 404 errors. To set up a 301 redirect in Shopify, go to Online Store > Navigation > URL Redirects. Enter the old URL and the new destination URL, then click Save.

mainEntity.name: Does Shopify automatically optimize my URLs for SEO?

acceptedAnswer.text: Shopify creates SEO-friendly URLs by default using a simple structure with fixed subdirectories and page names as slugs. Shopify also automatically generates canonical tags, but it's recommended to manually optimize slugs with relevant keywords for better SEO performance.

hasDefinedTerm.name: URL Slug
hasDefinedTerm.description: The user-friendly part of a URL that identifies a specific page, typically derived from the page title and optimized for SEO.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Custom Domain
hasDefinedTerm.description: A personalized web address (like yourshop.com) that replaces the default Shopify subdomain for better branding and credibility.

hasDefinedTerm.name: 301 Redirect
hasDefinedTerm.description: A permanent redirect that forwards traffic from one URL to another while preserving SEO value and preventing 404 errors.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Canonical Tags
hasDefinedTerm.description: HTML elements that help search engines identify the preferred version of a page when duplicate content exists.
